work.name: Laboratory for Control and Information Systems
highlights: Conduct signal processing such as preprocessing, filter design, time- and frequency-domain analysis, and feature extraction on 5 different physiological signals measured from 600+ subects.

Design and implement algorithms for signal preprocessing, system identification (including multi-blind system identification), optimization, and data analysis on physiological signals with extensive parameter tuning in MATLAB/Python.
Collaborate with a team of four to develop a novel method for detecting and monitoring aneurysms by analyzing non-invasive physiological signals.
Create and present weekly summaries of research progress, leading discussions on findings and their implications to drive productive, goal-oriented discussions and strategic planning.

skills.name: Engineering
keywords: Lab skills including soldering, power tools

publications.name: Transmission Line Model as a Digital Twin for Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Patients
publications.summary: We investigated the potential of the transmission line model as a digital twin of aneurysmal aorta by comparatively analyzing how a uniform lossless tube-load model were fitted to the carotid and femoral artery tonometry waveforms from abdominal aortic aneurysm patients vs. their matched controls.

publications.name: Tube-Load Model as a Digital Twin for Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Patients (poster)
publications.publisher: IEEE International Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society Conference
publications.summary: To investigate the feasibility of tube-load models as a digital twin to detect and monitor abdominal aortic aneurysms, helping to improve accessibility to screening and surveillance.

publications.name: Tube-Load Modeling of Aorta with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (poster)
publications.publisher: IEEE International Conference on Biomedical and Health Informatics
publications.summary: To investigate the feasibility of tube-load models in tracking the progression of abdominal aortic aneurysm in a patient pre- and post-endovascular repair surgery.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
